column4: I'm using Ubuntu server, and I'm having issues with my wlan setup... ath0 is defined in the /etc/network/interfaces but after boot I get "No Such device if I do iwconfig on it... Setup tho detected ath0 and it configured it there
is the ath_pci module loaded?
rausb: how do I check / where is it configured to load?
it should load automatically on system boot (as long as you didn't blacklist the module)
check if it is loaded with:  lsmod | grep ath_pci
rausb: I've changed nothing since the install... lsmod|grep ath_pci returns nothing
do you see the atheros card in the output of "lspci"?
yep it's listed - AR500G
and does   modinfo ath_pci  return anything?
couldn't find module
thats the problem
rausb: yeah, sounds like it... but why did setup load it then, that means it must be either on the cd or somehwhere in the filesystem... is there an easy way to install it...
check if you have the linux-restricted-modules-YOURKERNELVERSION package installed
the ath_pci (madwifi) driver is not fully open source
therefore it is in restricted-modules
but is the package on the server install cd? and how do I check if it's installed (and yes, I realise I'm a noob...)
dpkg -l | grep restricted
is the restricted-modules package on the install cd?
i think so
if you have internet access, you can also tell apt to fetch packages from the net
I realize, but that wifi is my internet connection on that pc
i see
